title: Two Counties Way Walking Route

images.title: Derek Harper / Footbridge, Netherclay
images.caption: Footbridge, Netherclay. The brick bridge crosses the River Tone, linking Netherclay to the new area of woodland on the north bank. The river is flowing to the right. Taken from footpath T3/13.

images.title: Stephen McKay / River Exe, Exeter
images.caption: River Exe, Exeter. This mild February Saturday afternoon was perfect for a stroll along the riverbank. Seen from Exe Bridge South.

images.title: Powderham Castle by John Jennings, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Powderham Castle

description: Travel through Somerset and Devon on this beautiful walk from Taunton to Starcross. There is much to enjoy on this varied walk with peaceful waterside sections along the River Tone, the Grand Western Canal and the River Exe real highlights. Also stop for a visit at the lovely National Trust owned Killerton Park in Broadclyst. This 18th century house boasts a historic fashion exhibition and stunning gardens. The route passes Wellington, Sampford Peverell, Tiverton, Bickleigh, Exeter and Powderham Castle before finishing on the Exe Estuary at Starcross.
